alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd, Knott and Pike. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkhorn City, Wheelwright, Virgie, Jonancy, Dorton, Myra, Lookout, Rockhouse, Beaver, Ligon, Buckhorn Hollow, Ashcamp, Speight, Melvin, Marrowbone, Burton, Belcher, Hi Hat, Halo and Buckingham.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
